title: (x) Chess Folkets mobiloperatør - TheMix {Mike Y}
content:
I need help id these fonts.

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [flere.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218164301/http:/typophile.com/files/flere.pdf) | 6.14 KB |
| [folkets.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218164301/http:/typophile.com/files/folkets.pdf) | 8.37 KB |
| [logo.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218164301/http:/typophile.com/files/logo.pdf) | 8.2 KB |

 [‹ Which classic serif font is this?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218164301/http:/typophile.com/node/15598 "Go to previous forum topic") [70's Pong system font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218164301/http:/typophile.com/node/15512 "Go to next forum topic")
author: henand

comments.content:
’Flere” looks Luc(as) de Groot’s “TheMix” italic.

- Mike Yanega

Henand - Mike’s right - they’re all ’The Mix’ by Lucas de Groot, they’re simply different weights of the same face.

Hope this helps

Si

The others are just the Roman version of [TheMix](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218164301/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=TheMix&image.x=18&image.y=7)

- Mike Yanega

Thanks to both of you..

That helps a lot.
